post.summary: Change IP range of a Network
post.description:
Changes the IP range of a [Network](#networks).

The following restrictions apply to changing the IP range:
- IP ranges can only be extended and never shrunk.
- IPs can only be added to the end of the existing range, therefore only the netmask is allowed to be changed.

To update the routes on the connected [Servers](#servers), they need to be rebooted or the routes to be updated manually.

For example if the [Network](#networks) has a range of `10.0.0.0/16` to extend it the new range has to start with the IP `10.0.0.0` as well. The netmask `/16` can be changed to a smaller one then `16` therefore increasing the IP range. A valid entry would be `10.0.0.0/15`, `10.0.0.0/14` or `10.0.0.0/13` and so on.

If a change is currently being performed on this [Network](#networks), a error response with code `conflict` will be returned.

parameters.description: ID of the Network.
parameters.name: id

ip_range.description:
IP range of the [Network](#networks).

Uses CIDR notation.

Must span all included subnets. Must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918.

Minimum network size is /24. We highly recommend that you pick a larger [Network](#networks) with a /16 netmask.

201.description:
Response for changing the [Networks](#networks) IP range.

The `action` key contains an [Action](#actions) with command `change_ip_range`.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
x-codeSamples.source:
package examples

import (
	"context"
	"os"

	"github.com/hetznercloud/hcloud-go/v2/hcloud"
)

func main() {
	token := os.Getenv("HCLOUD_TOKEN")

	client := hcloud.NewClient(hcloud.WithToken(token))
	ctx := context.TODO()

	action, _, err := client.Network.ChangeProtection(ctx, &hcloud.Network{ID: 123},
		hcloud.NetworkChangeProtectionOpts{Delete: hcloud.Ptr(true)})

	err = client.Action.WaitFor(ctx, action)
}

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.networks import Network

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.networks.change_protection(
    network=Network(id=123),
    delete=True,
)

action.wait_until_finished()

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud network enable-protection $NETWORK delete
hcloud network disable-protection $NETWORK delete

post.description:
Create a new [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Can optionally be assigned to a resource by providing an `assignee_id` and `assignee_type`.

If not assigned to a resource the `datacenter` key needs to be provided. This can be either the ID or the name of the [Data Center](#data-centers) this [Primary IP](#primary-ips) shall be created in.

A [Primary IP](#primary-ips) can only be assigned to resource in the same [Data Center](#data-centers) later on.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                                                              |
|------------------------------ |------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The specified [Server](#servers) is running, but needs to be powered off |
| `server_has_ipv4`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an ipv4 address                       |
| `server_has_ipv6`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an ipv6 address                       |

requestBody.description:
Request Body for creating a new [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

The `datacenter` and `assignee_id`/`assignee_type` attributes are mutually exclusive.

name.description: Name of the Resource. Must be unique per Project.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

datacenter.description:
[Data Center](#data-centers) ID or name.

The  [Primary IP](#primary-ips) will be bound to this [Data Center](#data-centers). Omit if `assignee_id`/`assignee_type` is provided.

assignee_type.description:
Type of resource the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) can get assigned to.

Currently [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) can only be assigned to [Servers](#servers),
therefore this field must be set to `server`.

assignee_id.description:
ID of resource to assign the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) to.

Omitted if the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) should not get assigned.

auto_delete.description:
Auto deletion state.

If enabled the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) will be deleted once the assigned resource gets deleted.

Response for creating a [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Contains the newly created [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.primary_ips.create(
    assignee_id=17,
    assignee_type="server",
    auto_delete=False,
    datacenter="fsn1-dc8",
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
    name="my-resource",
    type="ipv4",
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

primary_ip = response.primary_ip

    --auto-delete=false \
    --datacenter fsn1-dc8 \
    --label "environment=prod" \
    --label "example.com/my=label" \
    --label "just-a-key=" \
    --name my-ip \
    --type ipv4

If assigned to a [Server](#servers) the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) will be unassigned automatically. The [Server](#servers) must be powered off (status `off`) in order for this operation to succeed.

parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.
parameters.name: id

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]

client.primary_ips.delete(

)

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source: hcloud primary-ip delete $PRIMARYIP

post.summary: Assign a Primary IP to a resource
post.description:
Assign a [Primary IP](#primary-ips) to a resource.

A [Server](#servers) can only have one [Primary IP](#primary-ips) of type `ipv4` and one of type `ipv6` assigned. If you need more IPs use [Floating IPs](#floating-ips).

A [Server](#servers) must be powered off (status `off`) in order for this operation to succeed.

#### Error Codes specific to this Call

| Code                          | Description                                                                      |
|------------------------------ |--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The [Server](#servers) is running, but needs to be powered off                   |
| `primary_ip_already_assigned` | [Primary IP](#primary-ips) is already assigned to a different [Server](#servers) |
| `server_has_ipv4`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an IPv4 address                               |
| `server_has_ipv6`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an IPv6 address                               |

parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.
parameters.name: id

assignee_type.description: Type of resource assigning the Primary IP to.

assignee_id.description: ID of a resource of type `assignee_type`.

201.description:
Response for assigning a [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Contains an [Action](#actions) of type `assign_primary_ip`.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.primary_ips.assign(
    primary_ip=PrimaryIP(id=123),
    assignee_id=4711,
    assignee_type="server",
)

action.wait_until_finished()

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source: hcloud primary-ip assign --server 4711 $PRIMARYIP

post.summary: Change reverse DNS records for a Primary IP
post.description:
Change the reverse DNS records for this [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Allows to modify the PTR records set for the IP address.

parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.
parameters.name: id

requestBody.description:
The `ip` attributes specifies for which IP address the record is set. For IPv4 addresses this must be the exact address of the [Primary IP](#primary-ips). For IPv6 addresses this must be a single address within the `/64` subnet of the [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

The `dns_ptr` attribute specifies the hostname used for the IP address. Must be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) without trailing dot.

For IPv6 [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) up to 100 entries can be created.

ip.description: Single IPv4 or IPv6 address to create pointer for.

dns_ptr.description:
Domain Name to point to.

PTR record content used for reverse DNS.

201.description:
Response for changing a [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) DNS pointer.

Contains an [Action](#actions) of type `change_dns_ptr`.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.primary_ips.change_dns_ptr(
    primary_ip=PrimaryIP(id=123),
    dns_ptr="server.example.com",
    ip="2001:db8::1",
)

action.wait_until_finished()

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud primary-ip set-rdns $PRIMARYIP \
    --ip 1.2.3.4 \
    --hostname server02.example.com

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud server list

post.description: Creates a new Server. Returns preliminary information about the Server as well as an Action that covers progress of creation.

requestBody.description:
Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes).

For `server_type` you can either use the ID as listed in `/server_types` or its name.

For `image` you can either use the ID as listed in `/images` or its name.

If you want to create the Server in a Location, you must set `location` to the ID or name as listed in `/locations`. This is the recommended way. You can be even more specific by setting `datacenter` to the ID or name as listed in `/datacenters`. However we only recommend this if you want to assign a specific Primary IP to the Server which is located in the specified Data Center.

Some properties like `start_after_create` or `automount` will trigger Actions after the Server is created. Those Actions are listed in the `next_actions` field in the response.

For accessing your Server we strongly recommend to use SSH keys by passing the respective key IDs in `ssh_keys`. If you do not specify any `ssh_keys` we will generate a root password for you and return it in the response.

Please note that provided user-data is stored in our systems. While we take measures to protect it we highly recommend that you don’t use it to store passwords or other sensitive information.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                             | Description                                                |
|----------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| `placement_error`                | An error during the placement occurred                     |
| `primary_ip_assigned`            | The specified Primary IP is already assigned to a server   |
| `primary_ip_datacenter_mismatch` | The specified Primary IP is in a different datacenter      |
| `primary_ip_version_mismatch`    | The specified Primary IP has the wrong IP Version          |

name.description: Name of the Server to create (must be unique per Project and a valid hostname as per RFC 1123).

location.description: ID or name of Location to create Server in (must not be used together with datacenter).

datacenter.description: ID or name of Data Center to create Server in (must not be used together with location).

server_type.description: ID or name of the Server type this Server should be created with.

start_after_create.description: This automatically triggers a [Power on a Server-Server Action](#server-actions-power-on-a-server) after the creation is finished and is returned in the `next_actions` response object.

image.description: ID or name of the Image the Server is created from.

placement_group.description: ID of the Placement Group the Server should be in.

ssh_keys.description: SSH key IDs (`integer`) or names (`string`) which should be injected into the Server at creation time.

volumes.description: Volume IDs which should be attached to the Server at the creation time. Volumes must be in the same Location.

networks.description: Network IDs which should be attached to the Server private network interface at the creation time.

firewalls.description: Firewalls which should be applied on the Server's public network interface at creation time.

user_data.description: Cloud-Init user data to use during Server creation. This field is limited to 32KiB.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

enable_ipv4.description: Attach an IPv4 on the public NIC. If false, no IPv4 address will be attached.

enable_ipv6.description: Attach an IPv6 on the public NIC. If false, no IPv6 address will be attached.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.firewalls import Firewall
from hcloud.images import Image
from hcloud.locations import Location
from hcloud.networks import Network
from hcloud.placement_groups import PlacementGroup
from hcloud.server_types import ServerType
from hcloud.servers import ServerCreatePublicNetwork
from hcloud.ssh_keys import SSHKey
from hcloud.volumes import Volume

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.servers.create(
    automount=False,
    datacenter="hel1-dc2",
    firewalls=[Firewall(id=38)],
    image=Image(name="ubuntu-24.04"),
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
    location=Location(name="hel1"),
    name="my-server",
    networks=[Network(id=456)],
    placement_group=PlacementGroup(id=1),
    public_net=ServerCreatePublicNetwork(
        enable_ipv4=False,
        enable_ipv6=False,
        ipv4=None,
        ipv6=None,
    ),
    server_type=ServerType(name="cpx22"),
    ssh_keys=[SSHKey(name="my-ssh-key")],
    start_after_create=True,
    user_data="#cloud-config\nruncmd:\n- [touch, /root/cloud-init-worked]\n",
    volumes=[Volume(id=123)],
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

server = response.server

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud server create \
    --automount=false \
    --datacenter hel1-dc2 \
    --firewall 38 \
    --image ubuntu-24.04 \
    --label "environment=prod" \
    --label "example.com/my=label" \
    --label "just-a-key=" \
    --location hel1 \
    --name my-server \
    --network 456 \
    --placement-group 1 \
    --without-ipv4 \
    --without-ipv6 \
    --type cpx22 \
    --ssh-key my-ssh-key \
    --start-after-create \
    --volume 123 \
    --user-data-from-file <(printf '#cloud-config\nruncmd:\n- [touch, /root/cloud-init-worked]\n')

get.description: Returns all Action objects. You can `sort` the results by using the sort URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` and `id` parameter.

parameters.description:
Filter the actions by ID. Can be used multiple times. The response will only contain
actions matching the specified IDs.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Sort actions by field and direction. Can be used multiple times. For more
information, see "[Sorting](#sorting)".
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description:
Filter the actions by status. Can be used multiple times. The response will only
contain actions matching the specified statuses.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Page number to return. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: per_page

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

per_page.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page.

previous_page.description: Page number of the previous page. Can be null if the current page is the first one.

next_page.description: Page number of the next page. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

last_page.description: Page number of the last page available. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

total_entries.description: Total number of entries that exist for this query. Can be null if unknown.

datacenter.description: Data Center this Resource is located at.

name.description:
Unique name for the [Data Center](#data-centers).

description.description:
Descriptive name for the [Data Center](#data-centers).

Desired to be easy to understand for humans. Might be changed for cosmetic reasons. Do not use this as an identifier.

location.description: [Location](#locations) the [Data Center](#data-centers) is located at.

name.description: Unique identifier of the [Location](#locations).

country.description:
Country the [Location](#locations) resides in.

ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country.

city.description:
Name of the closest city to the [Location](#locations).

City name or city name and state in short form. E.g. `Falkenstein` or `Ashburn, VA`.

latitude.description: Latitude of the city closest to the [Location](#locations).

longitude.description: Longitude of the city closest to the [Location](#locations).

network_zone.description: Name of the Network Zone this [Location](#locations) resides in.

server_types.description: [Server Types](#server-types) supported and available in this [Data Center](#data-centers).

supported.description:
List of [Server Types](#server-types) supported in this [Data Center](#data-centers).

These [Server Types](#server-types) are generally available in this Data Center, but might be
temporarily out of stock.

available.description:
[Server Types](#server-types) currently available in this [Data Center](#data-centers).

These [Server Types](#server-types) can currently be purchased. Types that are temporarily unavailable
but are supported in this [Data Center](#data-centers) are listed as `supported`.

available_for_migration.description:
[Server Types](#server-types) available to migrate to in this [Data Center](#data-centers).

Existing [Servers](#servers) can be migrated to these [Server Types](#server-types).

image.description: Image the server is based on.

status.description: Whether the Image can be used or if it's still being created or unavailable.

name.description: Unique identifier of the Image. This value is only set for system Images.

image_size.description: Size of the Image file in our storage in GB. For snapshot Images this is the value relevant for calculating costs for the Image.

disk_size.description: Size of the disk contained in the Image in GB.

created.description: Point in time when the Resource was created (in ISO-8601 format).

created_from.description: Information about the Server the Image was created from.

id.description: ID of the Server the Image was created from.

name.description: Server name at the time the Image was created.

bound_to.description: ID of Server the Image is bound to. Only set for Images of type `backup`.

os_flavor.description: Flavor of operating system contained in the Image.

rapid_deploy.description: Indicates that rapid deploy of the Image is available.

delete.description: Prevent the Resource from being deleted.

deprecated.description: Point in time when the Image is considered to be deprecated (in ISO-8601 format).

User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.

iso.description: ISO Image that is attached to this Server. Null if no ISO is attached.

deprecation.title: DeprecationInfo
deprecation.description:
Describes if, when and how the resource is deprecated. If this field is
set to `null` the resource is not deprecated. If a value is set, it is
considered deprecated.

unavailable_after.description:
Date of the deprecated resource removal.

Once this date is reached, the resource will not be returned
by resource type "list" endpoint, and the resource can not be
used to create new resources. For example, if this is an
image, you can not create new servers with this image after
the mentioned date.

architecture.description:

rescue_enabled.description: True if rescue mode is enabled. Server will then boot into rescue system on next reboot.

locked.description: True if Server has been locked and is not available to user.

backup_window.description: Time window (UTC) in which the backup will run, or null if the backups are not enabled.

outgoing_traffic.description: Outbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes.

ingoing_traffic.description: Inbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes.

included_traffic.description: Free Traffic for the current billing period in bytes.

post.summary: Attach a Server to a Network
post.description:
Attaches a Server to a network. This will complement the fixed public Server interface by adding an additional ethernet interface to the Server which is connected to the specified network.

The Server will get an IP auto assigned from a subnet of type `server` in the same `network_zone`.

Using the `alias_ips` attribute you can also define one or more additional IPs to the Servers. Please note that you will have to configure these IPs by hand on your Server since only the primary IP will be given out by DHCP.

**Call specific error codes**

| Code                             | Description                                                           |
|----------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `server_already_attached`        | The server is already attached to the network                         |
| `ip_not_available`               | The provided Network IP is not available                              |
| `no_subnet_available`            | No Subnet or IP is available for the Server within the network        |
| `networks_overlap`               | The network IP range overlaps with one of the server networks         |

parameters.description: ID of the Server.
parameters.name: id

network.description: ID of an existing network to attach the Server to.

ip.description: IP to request to be assigned to this Server; if you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP address.

alias_ips.description: Additional IPs to be assigned to this Server.

ip_range.description:
IP range in CIDR block notation of the subnet to attach to.

This allows for auto assigning an IP address for a specific subnet.
Providing `ip` that is not part of `ip_range` will result in an error.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

from hcloud.networks import Network
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.servers.attach_to_network(
    server=Server(id=123),
    alias_ips=["10.0.1.2"],
    ip="10.0.1.1",
    network=Network(id=4711),
)

action.wait_until_finished()

    --ip 10.0.1.1 \
    --network 4711

post.summary: Change the Type of a Server
post.description:
Changes the type (Cores, RAM and disk sizes) of a Server.

Server must be powered off for this command to succeed.

This copies the content of its disk, and starts it again.

You can only migrate to Server types with the same `storage_type` and equal or bigger disks. Shrinking disks is not possible as it might destroy data.

If the disk gets upgraded, the Server type can not be downgraded any more. If you plan to downgrade the Server type, set `upgrade_disk` to `false`.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `invalid_server_type`         | The server type does not fit for the given server or is deprecated   |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The action requires a stopped server                                 |

parameters.description: ID of the Server.
parameters.name: id

upgrade_disk.description: If false, do not upgrade the disk (this allows downgrading the Server type later).

server_type.description: ID or name of Server type the Server should migrate to.

post.description:
Creates an Image (snapshot) from a Server by copying the contents of its disks. This creates a snapshot of the current state of the disk and copies it into an Image. If the Server is currently running you must make sure that its disk content is consistent. Otherwise, the created Image may not be readable.

To make sure disk content is consistent, we recommend to shut down the Server prior to creating an Image.

You can either create a `backup` Image that is bound to the Server and therefore will be deleted when the Server is deleted, or you can create a `snapshot` Image which is completely independent of the Server it was created from and will survive Server deletion. Backup Images are only available when the backup option is enabled for the Server. Snapshot Images are billed on a per GB basis.

post.summary: Enable Rescue Mode for a Server
post.description:
Enable the Hetzner Rescue System for this Server. The next time a Server with enabled rescue mode boots it will start a special minimal Linux distribution designed for repair and reinstall.

In case a Server cannot boot on its own you can use this to access a Server’s disks.

Rescue Mode is automatically disabled when you first boot into it or if you do not use it for 60 minutes.

Enabling rescue mode will not [reboot](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#server-actions-soft-reboot-a-server) your Server — you will have to do this yourself.

parameters.description: ID of the Server.
parameters.name: id

type.description: Type of rescue system to boot.

ssh_keys.description: Array of SSH key IDs which should be injected into the rescue system.

The `root_password` key in the reply contains the root password that can be used to access the booted rescue system.

post.summary: Rebuild a Server from an Image
post.description:
Rebuilds a Server overwriting its disk with the content of an Image, thereby **destroying all data** on the target Server

The Image can either be one you have created earlier (`backup` or `snapshot` Image) or it can be a completely fresh `system` Image provided by us. You can get a list of all available Images with `GET /images`.

Your Server will automatically be powered off before the rebuild command executes.

parameters.description: ID of the Server.
parameters.name: id

requestBody.description: To select which Image to rebuild from you can either pass an ID or a name as the `image` argument. Passing a name only works for `system` Images since the other Image types do not have a name set.

}

get.description: Returns a specific Action object for a Server.

parameters.description: ID of the Server.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply has this structure.

get.description:
Get Metrics for specified Server.

You must specify the type of metric to get: cpu, disk or network. You can also specify more than one type by comma separation, e.g. cpu,disk.

Depending on the type you will get different time series data

| Type    | Timeseries              | Unit      | Description                                          |
|---------|-------------------------|-----------|------------------------------------------------------|
| cpu     | cpu                     | percent   | Percent CPU usage                                    |
| disk    | disk.0.iops.read        | iop/s     | Number of read IO operations per second              |
|         | disk.0.iops.write       | iop/s     | Number of write IO operations per second             |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.read   | bytes/s   | Bytes read per second                                |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.write  | bytes/s   | Bytes written per second                             |
| network | network.0.pps.in        | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second received |
|         | network.0.pps.out       | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second sent     |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.in  | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s received            |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.out | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s sent                |

Metrics are available for the last 30 days only.

If you do not provide the step argument we will automatically adjust it so that a maximum of 200 samples are returned.

We limit the number of samples returned to a maximum of 500 and will adjust the step parameter accordingly.

parameters.description: ID of the Server.
parameters.name: id
type
parameters.description: Type of metrics to get.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format).

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format).

parameters.name: step
parameters.description: Resolution of results in seconds.

200.description: The `metrics` key in the reply contains a metrics object with this structure.

start.description: Start of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format).

end.description: End of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format).

time_series.description: Hash with timeseries information, containing the name of timeseries as key.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

import datetime
from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.servers.get_metrics(
    server=Server(id=123),
    start=datetime.datetime(2017, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, datetime.UTC),
    end=datetime.datetime(2017, 1, 1, 23, 0, 0, 0, datetime.UTC),
    step=60,
    type=[
        "cpu",
        "network",
        "disk",
    ],
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

metrics = response.metrics

hcloud server metrics $SERVER \
    --type cpu,network,disk \
    --start 2017-01-01T00:00:00Z \
    --end 2017-01-01T23:00:00Z

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.ssh_keys import SSHKey

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]

)

post.description:
Creates a new Volume attached to a Server. If you want to create a Volume that is not attached to a Server, you need to provide the `location` key instead of `server`. This can be either the ID or the name of the Location this Volume will be created in. Note that a Volume can be attached to a Server only in the same Location as the Volume itself.

Specifying the Server during Volume creation will automatically attach the Volume to that Server after it has been initialized. In that case, the `next_actions` key in the response is an array which contains a single `attach_volume` action.

The minimum Volume size is 10GB and the maximum size is 10TB (10240GB).

A volume’s name can consist of alphanumeric characters, dashes, underscores, and dots, but has to start and end with an alphanumeric character. The total length is limited to 64 characters. Volume names must be unique per Project.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                                | Description                                         |
|-------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| `no_space_left_in_location`         | There is no volume space left in the given location |

size.description: Size of the Volume in GB.

name.description: Name of the volume.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

automount.description: Auto-mount Volume after attach. `server` must be provided.

format.description: Format Volume after creation. One of: `xfs`, `ext4`.

location.description: Location to create the Volume in (can be omitted if Server is specified).

server.description: Server to which to attach the Volume once it's created (Volume will be created in the same Location as the server).

201.description:
The `volume` key contains the Volume that was just created.

The `action` key contains the Action tracking Volume creation.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.locations import Location

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.volumes.create(
    automount=False,
    format="xfs",
    labels={"key": "value"},
    location=Location(name="nbg1"),
    name="test-database",
    size=42,
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

volume = response.volume

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud volume create \
    --automount=false \
    --format xfs \
    --label "key=value" \
    --location nbg1 \
    --name test-database \
    --size 42

get.description:
Returns all [Zones](#zones).

Use the provided URI parameters to modify the result.

parameters.description:
Filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources
matching exactly the specified name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description:
Filter resources by their mode. The response will only contain the resources
matching exactly the specified mode.
parameters.name: mode

schema.description:
Mode of the [Zone](#zones).

For more information, see [Zone Modes](#zones).

parameters.description:
Filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the
label selector. For more information, see "[Label Selector](#label-selector)".
parameters.name: label_selector

parameters.description:
Sort resources by field and direction. Can be used multiple times. For more
information, see "[Sorting](#sorting)".
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Page number to return. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: per_page

200.description: Request succeeded.

name.description:
Name of the [Zone](#zones).

All names with [well-known public suffixes](https://publicsuffix.org/) (e.g. `.de`,
`.com`, `.co.uk`) are supported. Subdomains are not supported.

The name must be in lower case and must not end with a dot.
[Internationalized domain
names](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalized_domain_name) must be
transcribed to [Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with
ACE prefix, e.g. `xn--mnchen-3ya.de` (`münchen.de`).

created.description: Point in time when the Resource was created (in ISO-8601 format).

mode.description:
Mode of the [Zone](#zones).

For more information, see [Zone Modes](#zones).

primary_nameservers.description:
Primary nameservers of the [Zone](#zones).

Only set if [Zone](#zones) is in [secondary mode](#zone-mode), otherwise empty.

items.description:
Primary nameserver that returns [Zones](#zones) via `AXFR`.

Must allow queries from and may send `NOTIFY` queries to [Hetzner's secondary
nameservers](https://docs.hetzner.com/dns-console/dns/general/authoritative-name-servers#secondary-dns-servers-old-name-servers-for-robot-customers).

address.description: Public IPv4 or IPv6 address of the primary nameserver.

tsig_key.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) key to use
for the zone transfer. Must be base64 encoded.

tsig_algorithm.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) algorithm
used to generate the TSIG key.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

delete.description: Prevent the Resource from being deleted.

ttl.description:
Default Time To Live (TTL) of the [Zone](#zones).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

This TTL is used for [RRSets](#zone-rrsets) that do not explicitly define a TTL.

status.description:
Status of the [Zone](#zones).

- `ok`: the Zone is pushed to the authoritative nameservers.
- `updating`: the Zone is currently being published to the authoritative nameservers.
- `error`: the Zone could not be published to the authoritative nameservers.

record_count.description: Number of resource records (RR) within the [Zone](#zones).

assigned.description: Authoritative Hetzner nameservers assigned to this [Zone](#zones).

delegated.description:
Authoritative nameservers currently delegated to by the parent DNS zone.

If these don't match the assigned authoritative nameservers, the DNS zone is currently not being served by Hetzner.

delegation_last_check.description: Point in time (in ISO-8601 format) when the DNS zone delegation was last checked.

delegation_status.description:
Status of the delegation.

- `valid` - Parent zone correctly delegates to assigned nameservers.
- `partially-valid` - Parent zone delegates to additional Hetzner nameservers not assigned to this zone.
- `invalid` - Parent zone does not delegate to the assigned nameservers.
- `lame` - Parent zone delegates to nameservers that don't know the zone.
- `unregistered` - Domain is not registered.
- `unknown` - Not yet known.

per_page.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page.

previous_page.description: Page number of the previous page. Can be null if the current page is the first one.

next_page.description: Page number of the next page. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

last_page.description: Page number of the last page available. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

post.description:
Creates a [Zone](#zones).

A default `SOA` and three `NS` resource records with the assigned Hetzner
nameservers are created automatically.

name.description:
Name of the [Zone](#zones).

All names with [well-known public suffixes](https://publicsuffix.org/) (e.g. `.de`,
`.com`, `.co.uk`) are supported. Subdomains are not supported.

The name must be in lower case and must not end with a dot.
[Internationalized domain
names](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalized_domain_name) must be
transcribed to [Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with
ACE prefix, e.g. `xn--mnchen-3ya.de` (`münchen.de`).

mode.description:
Mode of the [Zone](#zones).

For more information, see [Zone Modes](#zones).

ttl.description:
Default Time To Live (TTL) of the [Zone](#zones).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

This TTL is used for [RRSets](#zone-rrsets) that do not explicitly define a TTL.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

primary_nameservers.description:
Primary nameservers of the [Zone](#zones).

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in secondary mode.
Ignored for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

items.description:
Primary nameserver that returns [Zones](#zones) via `AXFR`.

Must allow queries from and may send `NOTIFY` queries to [Hetzner's secondary
nameservers](https://docs.hetzner.com/dns-console/dns/general/authoritative-name-servers#secondary-dns-servers-old-name-servers-for-robot-customers).

address.description: Public IPv4 or IPv6 address of the primary nameserver.

tsig_key.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) key to use
for the zone transfer. Must be base64 encoded.

tsig_algorithm.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) algorithm
used to generate the TSIG key.

rrsets.description:
[RRSets](#zone-rrsets) to be added to the [Zone](#zones).

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.
Ignored for [Zones](#zones) in secondary mode.

name.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

ttl.description:
Time To Live (TTL) of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

If not set, the [Zone's](#zones) Default TTL is used.

records.description:
Records of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must not be empty and must only contain distinct record values.

items.title: Record
items.description:
Record of a [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The `value` is used to identify the record in an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

value.description:
Value of the record.

For details about accepted values, see the [DNS record types documentation](https://docs.hetzner.com/networking/dns/record-types/overview/).

comment.example: My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

zonefile.description:
Zone file to import.

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.
Ignored for [Zones](#zones) in secondary mode.

If provided, `rrsets` must be empty.

See [Zone file import](#zone-file-import) for more details.
zonefile.example:
$ORIGIN	example.com.
$TTL	3600

@	IN	SOA	hydrogen.ns.hetzner.com. dns.hetzner.com. 2024010100 86400 10800 3600000 3600

@	IN	10800	NS	hydrogen.ns.hetzner.com. ; Some comment.
@	IN	10800	NS	oxygen.ns.hetzner.com.
@	IN	10800	NS	helium.ns.hetzner.de.

records.comment: My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

value.name: example.com
value.zonefile:
$ORIGIN	example.com.
$TTL	10800

@	IN	A	198.51.100.1 ; My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

201.description: Request succeeded.

name.description:
Name of the [Zone](#zones).

All names with [well-known public suffixes](https://publicsuffix.org/) (e.g. `.de`,
`.com`, `.co.uk`) are supported. Subdomains are not supported.

The name must be in lower case and must not end with a dot.
[Internationalized domain
names](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalized_domain_name) must be
transcribed to [Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with
ACE prefix, e.g. `xn--mnchen-3ya.de` (`münchen.de`).

created.description: Point in time when the Resource was created (in ISO-8601 format).

mode.description:
Mode of the [Zone](#zones).

For more information, see [Zone Modes](#zones).

primary_nameservers.description:
Primary nameservers of the [Zone](#zones).

Only set if [Zone](#zones) is in [secondary mode](#zone-mode), otherwise empty.

items.description:
Primary nameserver that returns [Zones](#zones) via `AXFR`.

Must allow queries from and may send `NOTIFY` queries to [Hetzner's secondary
nameservers](https://docs.hetzner.com/dns-console/dns/general/authoritative-name-servers#secondary-dns-servers-old-name-servers-for-robot-customers).

address.description: Public IPv4 or IPv6 address of the primary nameserver.

tsig_key.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) key to use
for the zone transfer. Must be base64 encoded.

tsig_algorithm.description:
[Transaction signature (TSIG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSIG) algorithm
used to generate the TSIG key.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

delete.description: Prevent the Resource from being deleted.

ttl.description:
Default Time To Live (TTL) of the [Zone](#zones).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

This TTL is used for [RRSets](#zone-rrsets) that do not explicitly define a TTL.

status.description:
Status of the [Zone](#zones).

- `ok`: the Zone is pushed to the authoritative nameservers.
- `updating`: the Zone is currently being published to the authoritative nameservers.
- `error`: the Zone could not be published to the authoritative nameservers.

record_count.description: Number of resource records (RR) within the [Zone](#zones).

assigned.description: Authoritative Hetzner nameservers assigned to this [Zone](#zones).

delegated.description:
Authoritative nameservers currently delegated to by the parent DNS zone.

If these don't match the assigned authoritative nameservers, the DNS zone is currently not being served by Hetzner.

delegation_last_check.description: Point in time (in ISO-8601 format) when the DNS zone delegation was last checked.

delegation_status.description:
Status of the delegation.

- `valid` - Parent zone correctly delegates to assigned nameservers.
- `partially-valid` - Parent zone delegates to additional Hetzner nameservers not assigned to this zone.
- `invalid` - Parent zone does not delegate to the assigned nameservers.
- `lame` - Parent zone delegates to nameservers that don't know the zone.
- `unregistered` - Domain is not registered.
- `unknown` - Not yet known.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go (primary from zone file)
Go (primary)
Go (secondary)
Python (primary from zone file)
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.zones.create(
    name="example.com",
    mode="primary",
    ttl=10800,
    labels={
        "key": "value",
    },
    zonefile="""$ORIGIN example.com.
$TTL    10800

@   IN  A   198.51.100.1 ; My web server at Hetzner Cloud.
""",
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

zone = response.zone

x-codeSamples.label: Python (primary)
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import ZoneRecord, ZoneRRSet

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.zones.create(
    name="example.com",
    mode="primary",
    ttl=10800,
    labels={
        "key": "value",
    },
    rrsets=[
        ZoneRRSet(
            name="www",
            type="A",
            records=[
                ZoneRecord(
                    value="198.51.100.1",
                    comment="My web server at Hetzner Cloud.",
                )
            ],
        )
    ],
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

zone = response.zone

x-codeSamples.label: Python (secondary)
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import ZonePrimaryNameserver

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.zones.create(
    name="example.com",
    mode="secondary",
    ttl=10800,
    labels={
        "key": "value",
    },
    primary_nameservers=[
        ZonePrimaryNameserver(address="198.51.100.1", port=53),
        ZonePrimaryNameserver(address="203.0.113.1", port=53),
    ],
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

zone = response.zone

    --name example.com \
    --mode primary \
    --ttl 10800 \
    --label "key=value" \
    --zonefile <(echo '$ORIGIN	example.com.
$TTL	10800

@	IN	A	198.51.100.1 ; My web server at Hetzner Cloud.
')

        {"address": "198.51.100.1", "port": 53},

    ]')

x-codeSamples.source:
package examples

import (
	"context"
	"os"

	"github.com/hetznercloud/hcloud-go/v2/hcloud"
)

func main() {
	token := os.Getenv("HCLOUD_TOKEN")

	client := hcloud.NewClient(hcloud.WithToken(token))
	ctx := context.TODO()

	action, _, err := client.Zone.ImportZonefile(ctx, &hcloud.Zone{Name: "example.com"}, hcloud.ZoneImportZonefileOpts{
		Zonefile: `$ORIGIN	example.com.
$TTL	3600

@	IN	SOA	hydrogen.ns.hetzner.com. dns.hetzner.com. 2024010100 86400 10800 3600000 3600

@	IN	10800	NS	hydrogen.ns.hetzner.com. ; Some comment.
@	IN	10800	NS	oxygen.ns.hetzner.com.
@	IN	10800	NS	helium.ns.hetzner.de.
`,
	})

	err = client.Action.WaitFor(ctx, action)
}

get.description:
Returns all [RRSets](#zone-rrsets) in the [Zone](#zones).

Use the provided URI parameters to modify the result.

The maximum value for `per_page` on this endpoint is `100` instead of `50`.

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                  | Description                      |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------|
| `incorrect_zone_mode` | The zone is not in primary mode. |

parameters.description: ID or Name of the Zone.
parameters.name: id_or_name

parameters.description:
Filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources
matching exactly the specified name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description:
Filter resources by their type. Can be used multiple times. The response will only
contain resources matching the specified types.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description:
Filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the
label selector. For more information, see "[Label Selector](#label-selector)".
parameters.name: label_selector

parameters.description:
Sort resources by field and direction. Can be used multiple times. For more
information, see "[Sorting](#sorting)".
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Page number to return. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".
parameters.name: per_page

200.description: Request succeeded.

id.description:
ID of the RRSet.

The ID is composed of the name and type, joined with a slash (e.g. `www/AAAA`).

name.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

ttl.description:
Time To Live (TTL) of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

If not set, the [Zone's](#zones) Default TTL is used.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

change.description: Prevent the Resource from being changed.

records.description:
Records of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must not be empty and must only contain distinct record values.

items.title: Record
items.description:
Record of a [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The `value` is used to identify the record in an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

value.description:
Value of the record.

For details about accepted values, see the [DNS record types documentation](https://docs.hetzner.com/networking/dns/record-types/overview/).

comment.example: My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

per_page.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page.

previous_page.description: Page number of the previous page. Can be null if the current page is the first one.

next_page.description: Page number of the next page. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

last_page.description: Page number of the last page available. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

total_entries.description: Total number of entries that exist for this query. Can be null if unknown.

from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import Zone, ZoneRecord

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.zones.create_rrset(
    zone=Zone(name="example.com"),
    name="www",
    type="A",
    ttl=3600,
    records=[
        ZoneRecord(
            value="198.51.100.1",
            comment="My web server at Hetzner Cloud.",
        )
    ],
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

rrset = response.rrset

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud zone rrset create $ZONE \
    --name www \
    --type A \
    --ttl 3600 \
    --record "198.51.100.1" \
    --label "environment=prod" \
    --label "example.com/my=label" \
    --label "just-a-key="

post.description:
Changes the Time To Live (TTL) of an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) in the [Zone](#zones).

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                  | Description                      |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------|
| `incorrect_zone_mode` | The zone is not in primary mode. |

parameters.description: ID or Name of the Zone.
parameters.name: id_or_name

schema.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

ttl.description:
Time To Live (TTL) of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must be in between 60s and 2147483647s.

If not set, the [Zone's](#zones) Default TTL is used.

201.description: Request succeeded.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import Zone, ZoneRRSet

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.zones.change_rrset_ttl(
    rrset=ZoneRRSet(
        zone=Zone(name="example.com"),
        name="www",
        type="A",
    ),
    ttl=3600,
)

action.wait_until_finished()

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source: hcloud zone rrset change-ttl $ZONE $RR_NAME $RR_TYPE --ttl 3600

post.description:
Overwrites the resource records (RRs) of an existing [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) in the [Zone](#zones).

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                  | Description                      |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------|
| `incorrect_zone_mode` | The zone is not in primary mode. |

parameters.description: ID or Name of the Zone.
parameters.name: id_or_name

schema.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

records.description:
Records to set in the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must not be empty and must only contain distinct record values.

items.title: Record
items.description:
Record of a [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The `value` is used to identify the record in an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

value.description:
Value of the record.

For details about accepted values, see the [DNS record types documentation](https://docs.hetzner.com/networking/dns/record-types/overview/).

comment.example: My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

201.description: Request succeeded.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import Zone, ZoneRecord, ZoneRRSet

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.zones.set_rrset_records(
    rrset=ZoneRRSet(
        zone=Zone(name="example.com"),
        name="www",
        type="A",
    ),
    records=[
        ZoneRecord(value="198.51.100.1", comment="My web server at Hetzner Cloud.")
    ],
)

action.wait_until_finished()

x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.description:
Adds resource records (RRs) to an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) in the [Zone](#zones).

For convenience, the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) will be automatically created if it doesn't exist. Otherwise, the new
records are appended to the existing [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                  | Description                      |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------|
| `incorrect_zone_mode` | The zone is not in primary mode. |

parameters.description: ID or Name of the Zone.
parameters.name: id_or_name

schema.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

ttl.description:
Time To Live (TTL) of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

If not set, the [Zone's](#zones) Default TTL is used.
If set, and the RRSet being updated already has a TTL, the values must be the same.

records.description:
Records to add to the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must not be empty and must only contain distinct record values.

items.title: Record
items.description:
Record of a [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The `value` is used to identify the record in an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

value.description:
Value of the record.

For details about accepted values, see the [DNS record types documentation](https://docs.hetzner.com/networking/dns/record-types/overview/).

comment.example: My web server at Hetzner Cloud.

201.description: Request succeeded.

schema.title: ActionResponse
schema.description:
Response for a created [Action](#actions).

Make sure to wait for the [Action](#actions) completion to ensure your changes are applied.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:

from os import environ

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.zones import Zone, ZoneRecord, ZoneRRSet

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]

action = client.zones.add_rrset_records(
    rrset=ZoneRRSet(
        zone=Zone(name="example.com"),
        name="www",
        type="A",
    ),
    ttl=3600,
    records=[
        ZoneRecord(value="198.51.100.1", comment="My web server at Hetzner Cloud.")
    ],
)

action.wait_until_finished()

post.description:
Removes resource records (RRs) from an existing [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) in the [Zone](#zones).

For convenience, the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets) will be automatically deleted if it doesn't contain any RRs afterwards.

Only applicable for [Zones](#zones) in primary mode.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                  | Description                      |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------|
| `incorrect_zone_mode` | The zone is not in primary mode. |

parameters.description: ID or Name of the Zone.
parameters.name: id_or_name

schema.description:
Name of the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The name must be in lower case, and must not end with a dot or the [Zone](#zones)
name. Names containing non-ASCII characters must be transcribed to
[Punycode](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Punycode) representation with ACE prefix, e.g.
`xn--4bi` (✉️).

For the [Zone](#zones) apex, use `@`.

records.description:
Records to remove from the [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

Must not be empty and must only contain distinct record values.

items.title: Record
items.description:
Record of a [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

The `value` is used to identify the record in an [RRSet](#zone-rrsets).

value.description:
Value of the record.

For details about accepted values, see the [DNS record types documentation](https://docs.hetzner.com/networking/dns/record-types/overview/).
